title: movie theater signage?
content:
Any guesses about this movie board typeface??? Check out that “P”!

Thanks for any tips!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203132908im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/moviesign_3745.jpg)

 [‹ Serif in Dagbladet Magasinet, quite similar to FF Olsen.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203132908/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45597 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font ID please... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203132908/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45580 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cwongyap

comments.content:
[James Montalbano](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203132908/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/James%252BMontalbano) designed [a typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203132908/http:/terminaldesign.com/fonts/characters/?ID=175) based on a similar marquee.

If you want a low-waisted face with a large-bowled P check out [Neutraface](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203132908/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=615), [Mostra](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203132908/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/mark_simonson/mostra/) or [Phosphate](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203132908/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/red_rooster/phosphate/).
